body_html:
Hi @Marcovaldong ,

I have already installed CUDA 8.0 and cuDNN 5.1.10. I solved the issue by switching only to cuDNN 7.0.5 and kept CUDA 8.0. Make sure that you do the following in the extracted folder of cuDNN 7.0.5 (I installed with the Linux library option from NVIDIA):

sudo cp -P include/cudnn.h /usr/local/cuda-8.0/include
sudo cp -P lib64/libcudnn* /usr/local/cuda-8.0/lib64

This leads to an overwrite of cuDNN files. This way, CMake will detect cuDNN 7.0.5 instead of cuDNN 5.1.10.

I have already installed CUDA 8.0 and cuDNN 5.1.10. I solved the issue by switching only to cuDNN 7.0.5 and kept CUDA 8.0. Make sure that you do the following in the extracted folder of cuDNN 7.0.5 (I installed with the Linux library option from NVIDIA):

```
sudo cp -P include/cudnn.h /usr/local/cuda-8.0/include
sudo cp -P lib64/libcudnn* /usr/local/cuda-8.0/lib64
```

This leads to an overwrite of cuDNN files. This way, CMake will detect cuDNN 7.0.5 instead of cuDNN 5.1.10.
